review: I just spent a frustrating hour and a half trying to set up my Chromecast.1.  I tried to use my iPad.  It's an iPad 1 and won't accept the App.2.  I tried to use my laptop.  First I had to download and install Chrome.  Then it wouldn't work because its running Windows XP.3.  I finally tried my iPhone (not my preferred internet device).  I installed the app then followed the instructions and found the Chromecast code number'ed network.  Named the net and then finally decided I was supposed to return to my own WiFi network.  Then it wanted my WiFi password.  While I went and found it, the connection timed out.  I tried to restart it, but kept looping back to the first screen.I've given up, I will return the Chromecast to Amazon for a refund!!!!
author: John Robertson

review: We already have APPLE TV, although CHROMECAST doesn't offer everything that APPLE TV does, its a nice alternative to have in addition for another TV in the home.  LOVE IT!!!
author: Mary O

review: Love it. Tiny and does what I need it to do. Wish I could cast a tab on my phone but I still love it.
author: Kayla Hayes

review: I'm an experienced Apple iPhone user and have always enjoyed Apple products. That being said, using an iPhone to operate a Chromecast is one of the simplest, user-friendly ways to watch Netflix or YouTube. My wife and I bought Apple TV's before Chromecast JUST to watch Netflix in other rooms (without using other bulky netflix-capable hardware: PS3, XBox, etc...).This really is a great piece of hardware. My only recommendation to Chromecast is to include other services like Amazon Prime Instant Video and possibly Mirroring.
author: ryandickneite

review: Doesn't stream as fast as I've seen Blu-Ray or Apple TV players stream, but works perfectly fine. Would buy again.
author: Max

review: These are great.  I have two at my house and two of the TVs at my office have them too (which doesn't help productivity all that much, but is totally great and super convenient anyway).  Plug it in and watch youtube/netflix/whatever without having to set up a set top box. I bought one for my parents as a gift and as a result they have been binge-watching netflix shows pretty much non-stop ever since.
author: Daniel B.

review: I know it's still in Beta, but it is a little annoying.  Overall very happy with the device, had to reboot my router for the initial setup to work properly, but no other problems since then.  Vimeo videos don't seem to cast that well, have to cast a whole tab and then it plays on the computer and simply twin-view's it's way onto the screen with some lag.  Again, overall a good product, I was just hoping it would have been great.
author: practical_tactical

review: Love the concept just kinda laggy.. might be my wifi so I don't want to bash it with horrible review but when watching youtube i get the pinwheel alot

review: Was able to cast directly from cell / laptop  Easy to install.and transportable to any tv, then when my son came to my house, he was instantly casting from cell too.

review: Works really well to transfer video from my Compaq laptop to my Visio HDTV.  Previously tried another streaming player (Imation) that was very frustrating to set up and performed erratically.Bravo Google - great product!
